trans-unit.source: Creates a device context for an enhanced-format metafile

seg-source.mrk: Creates a device context for an enhanced-format metafile

target.mrk: Creates a device context for an enhanced-format metafile

trans-unit.source: [optional] Handle to a reference device for the enhanced metafile. The system uses this device context to record the resolution and units of the device on which a picture originally appeared.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to a reference device for the enhanced metafile.
The system uses this device context to record the resolution and units of the device on which a picture originally appeared.

target.mrk: Handle to a reference device for the enhanced metafile.
The system uses this device context to record the resolution and units of the device on which a picture originally appeared.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is 0 (Default), it uses the current display device for reference.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is 0 (Default), it uses the current display device for reference.

target.mrk: If this parameter is 0 (Default), it uses the current display device for reference.

trans-unit.source: [optional] $tagRECT structure that specifies the dimensions of the picture to be stored in the enhanced metafile.

seg-source.mrk: $tagRECT structure that specifies the dimensions of the picture to be stored in the enhanced metafile.

target.mrk: $tagRECT structure that specifies the dimensions of the picture to be stored in the enhanced metafile.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is 0 (Default), the graphics device interface computes the dimensions of the smallest rectangle that surrounds the picture drawn by the application.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is 0 (Default), the graphics device interface computes the dimensions of the smallest rectangle that surrounds the picture drawn by the application.

target.mrk: If this parameter is 0 (Default), the graphics device interface computes the dimensions of the smallest rectangle that surrounds the picture drawn by the application.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies whether the $tRECT structure defined in pixels, valid values:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies whether the $tRECT structure defined in pixels, valid values:

target.mrk: Specifies whether the $tRECT structure defined in pixels, valid values:

trans-unit.source: [optional] The file name for the enhanced metafile to be created.

seg-source.mrk: The file name for the enhanced metafile to be created.

target.mrk: The file name for the enhanced metafile to be created.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is '' (Default), the enhanced metafile is memory based and its contents are lost when it is deleted by using the _WinAPI_DeleteEnhMetaFile() function.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is '' (Default), the enhanced metafile is memory based and its contents are lost when it is deleted by using the _WinAPI_DeleteEnhMetaFile() function.

target.mrk: If this parameter is '' (Default), the enhanced metafile is memory based and its contents are lost when it is deleted by using the _WinAPI_DeleteEnhMetaFile() function.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The string that specifies the name of the application that created the picture, as well as the picture's title. This string must be an empty string or represented as follows:

seg-source.mrk: The string that specifies the name of the application that created the picture, as well as the picture's title.
This string must be an empty string or represented as follows:

target.mrk: The string that specifies the name of the application that created the picture, as well as the picture's title.
This string must be an empty string or represented as follows:

trans-unit.source: Handle to the device context for the enhanced metafile.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the device context for the enhanced metafile.

target.mrk: Handle to the device context for the enhanced metafile.

trans-unit.source: Applications use the device context created by this function to store a graphics picture in an enhanced metafile.

seg-source.mrk: Applications use the device context created by this function to store a graphics picture in an enhanced metafile.

target.mrk: Applications use the device context created by this function to store a graphics picture in an enhanced metafile.

trans-unit.source: The handle identifying this device context can be passed to any GDI function.

seg-source.mrk: The handle identifying this device context can be passed to any GDI function.

target.mrk: The handle identifying this device context can be passed to any GDI function.

trans-unit.source: After an application stores a picture in an enhanced metafile, it can display the picture on any output device by calling the _WinAPI_PlayEnhMetaFile() function.

seg-source.mrk: After an application stores a picture in an enhanced metafile, it can display the picture on any output device by calling the _WinAPI_PlayEnhMetaFile() function.

target.mrk: After an application stores a picture in an enhanced metafile, it can display the picture on any output device by calling the _WinAPI_PlayEnhMetaFile() function.

trans-unit.source: When displaying the picture, the system uses the rectangle pointed to by the $tRECT parameter and the resolution data from the reference device to position and scale the picture.

seg-source.mrk: When displaying the picture, the system uses the rectangle pointed to by the $tRECT parameter and the resolution data from the reference device to position and scale the picture.

target.mrk: When displaying the picture, the system uses the rectangle pointed to by the $tRECT parameter and the resolution data from the reference device to position and scale the picture.

trans-unit.source: The file name for the enhanced metafile should use the .emf extension.

seg-source.mrk: The file name for the enhanced metafile should use the .emf extension.

target.mrk: The file name for the enhanced metafile should use the .emf extension.

trans-unit.source: Do you want to replace it?

seg-source.mrk: Do you want to replace it?

target.mrk: Do you want to replace it?
